docs.summary: Use this API to view and manage the Premium product catalog

params.name: productId
params.doc: ID of requested product

docs.summary: BO usage

params.name: featureSpecId
params.doc: ID of requested feature

docs.summary: Adds a new label to a feature. For internal BO usage.

params.name: featureSpecId
params.doc: ID of requested feature

docs.summary:
Adds given Product Type to the list of supported product types for this feature.
  Only products belonging to a product type in this list may include this feature.
  Typically each feature should have only 1 supported product type - to avoid overlapping of features from multiple subscriptions on the same context, but we still want to allow it in some cases in a controlled manner.

params.name: featureSpecId
params.doc: ID of requested feature

docs.summary:
Archives the feature so it can no longer be added to new products.
It does NOT remove it from existing products

params.name: productId
params.doc: ID of requested product

docs.summary: changes product status from PUBLISHED to ARCHIVED

params.name: name
params.doc: Name of the product type. Meant for internal use, but also serves as a fallback for display purposes when Product Type name is not provided by "Display Layer".

params.name: productSubscriptionSettingsId
params.doc: Reference to ProductSubscriptionSettings. Products belonging to this type will inherit these settings unless overridden.

params.name: primaryContext
params.doc: Context which the subscription will be assigned to.

docs.summary: Creates a new product type. ID is auto-generated.

params.name: id
params.doc:
Optional: specify the ID of the newly created entity. Useful for idempotent calls.
  Keep empty to let server auto-generate an ID

params.name: description
params.doc: Entity description - for internal use.

params.name: emailSettings
params.doc: deprecated use NotificationSettings instead

params.name: cancellationPolicy
params.doc:
Specify the official cancellation policy of the subscription.
  Chose none to inherit from parent settings object.

params.name: allowedActions
params.doc:
Control whether the following actions can be performed on the subscription.
  Action left empty will inherit from parent settings object. Default is false.

params.name: notificationSettings
params.doc:
Configure which events should trigger notifications as well as the requested template names (integrated with Ping).
  Leave empty to inherit from parent entity.

docs.summary: Creates a new product settings object. Resulting entity may be referenced by a "product", "product family" or a "product type"

params.name: name
params.doc: Display name of product family. for internal use.

params.name: productTypeId
params.doc: Product Type containing this family (there can be many product families in the same type).

params.name: productSubscriptionSettingsOverrideId
params.doc: ref to settings.ProductSubscriptionSettings

docs.summary: Create a new product family

params.name: id
params.doc:
Optional: specify the ID of the newly created Feature. Useful for idempotent calls.
  Keep empty to let server auto-generate an ID

params.name: uniqueName
params.doc: Readable name to be used as a reference in the code. alphanumeric and dashes.

params.name: displayName
params.doc: English name of the feature. Meant for internal usage, but also serves as a fallback for display properties when Feature name is not provided by "display layer".

params.name: description
params.doc: More information about this feature. For internal usage.

params.name: context
params.doc: Scope in which the feature takes effect. See FeatureContext for more info.

params.name: requiredForUpgrade
params.doc: Upgrade path restriction. Features with this flag set to "true" forbid upgrading a subscription from a product that DOES contain this feature to a product that DOESN'T.

params.name: quantity
params.doc: Quantity characteristics of the spec. Features without explicit information are assumed to be Boolean.

docs.summary: Creates a new feature. Feature will be set to DRAFT status.

body:
curl -X POST \
  https://www.wix.com/_api/premium-product-catalog/v1/feature \
  -H 'Authorization: <AUTH>' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'
  -d '{
          "uniqueName": "business_number_sms_automations",
          "displayName": "Business Number SMS Automations",
          "description": "Business Number based SMS automations",
          "context": "SITE",
          "requiredForUpgrade": false,
          "defaultQuota": {
            "limit": "10",
            "period": "MONTH",
            "units": ""
          }
        }'

params.name: id
params.doc:
Optional: specify the ID of the newly created Product. Useful for idempotent calls.
  Keep empty to let server auto-generate an ID.

params.name: name
params.doc: Name of the product. Meant for internal use, but also serves as a fallback for display purposes when Product name is not provided by "Display Layer".

params.name: description
params.doc: More information about this product. For internal use.

params.name: features
params.doc: Features that will be delivered when purchasing this product.

params.name: productTypeId
params.doc: ref to producttype.ProductType

params.name: productSettingsOverrideId
params.doc:
An optional reference ProductSubscriptionSettings.
  When empty, inherits the subscription management settings of its ancestors (product family, product type).
  When specified, non-empty attributes will override the settings inherited from its parent (empty attributes will still be inherited).

params.name: productFamilyId
params.doc:
A mandatory reference to ProductFamily entity.
Serves as secondary division of products into groups. Might be removed in future versions.

params.name: billingProductId
params.doc: reference to the SBS product catalog, containing the "pricing plan", "localization maps" and additional product settings

params.name: additionalProperties
params.doc: Set of key-value pairs.  General-purpose key-value store of properties attributed to this entity.

params.name: internalCouponTemplates
params.doc: Wix internal coupons that will be generated when purchasing this product

params.name: externalVoucherTemplates
params.doc: Non wix vouchers that will be given with this product

params.name: bulkLicenses
params.doc: List of license products and amounts

body:
curl -X POST \
  https://www.wix.com/_api/premium-product-catalog/v1/feature/12a16348-ffdd-4578-91f4-4142c7f9bc7e \
  -H 'Authorization: <AUTH>' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'
  -d '{
          "id": "12a16348-ffdd-4578-91f4-4142c7f9bc7e",
          "uniqueName": "business_number_sms_automations",
          "displayName": "Business Number SMS Automations",
          "description": "Business Number based SMS automations",
          "context": "SITE",
          "requiredForUpgrade": false,
          "defaultQuota": {
            "limit": "10",
            "period": "MONTH",
            "units": ""
          }
        }'

params.name: productId
params.doc: ID of requested products

params.name: name
params.doc: Name of the product. Meant for internal use, but also serves as a fallback for display purposes when Product name is not provided by "Display Layer".

params.name: description
params.doc:
More information about this product. For internal use.
  for internal BO use

params.name: features
params.doc: Features that will be delivered when purchasing this product.

params.name: productTypeId
params.doc: ref to com.wixpress.premium.productcatalog.api.v1.producttype.ProductType

params.name: productSettingsOverrideId
params.doc:
ref to settings.ProductSubscriptionSettings
product settings are inherited from "product type", but product-specific overrides are possible with this field

params.name: productFamilyId
params.doc:
ref to com.wixpress.premium.productcatalog.api.v1.productsubtype.ProductSubType
used to divide products into sub families, as well as manage upgrade paths.

params.name: billingProductId
params.doc:
reference to the SBS product catalog, containing the "pricing plan", "localization maps" and additional product settings
SBS product catalog is planned to be merged into this one in the future.

params.name: additionalProperties
params.doc: Set of key-value pairs.  General-purpose key-value store of properties attributed to this entity.

params.name: internalCouponTemplates
params.doc: Wix internal coupons that will be generated when purchasing this product

params.name: externalVoucherTemplates
params.doc: Non wix vouchers that will be given with this product

docs.summary:
Override the entire data of the product with the new payload (only works in draft mode)
  Note: partial update is not supported, you must specify all the fields in the request.

members.name: id
members.doc: Entity primary ID.

members.name: productTypeId
members.doc: Reference to parent product type

members.name: name
members.doc: Display name. For internal usage

members.name: productSubscriptionSettingsOverrideId
members.doc:
ref to settings.ProductSubscriptionSettings
product settings are inherited from "product type", but product-specific overrides are possible with this field

docs.summary:
A feature that can be either "enabled" or "disabled". The default/freemium setting is always OFF, and the premium setting is always ON (meaning, unlimited usage without tracking).
  A boolean feature is similar to a quantitive feature with a default limit of 0 and UNLIMITED premium limit (although a bit simplified).
A feature with a periodic usage limitation. The default limit is defined in the Feature Spec, the Premium limits are defined in the respective ProductFeature.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Default (or Freemium) quota limitation. if left undefined the free feature has unlimited amount.

members.name: period
members.doc: Periodic time-frame to reset the usage counter. You may use NO_PERIOD if counter shouldn't be reset.

members.name: units
members.doc: Usage measurement units (seconds? MBs? unitless?). Usage reported will be counted in multiples of this basic unit.

members.name: unit
members.doc: interval unit of measure

members.name: count
members.doc: number of interval

members.name: interval
members.doc: repetitive interval

members.name: oneTime
members.doc: one time

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.  General-purpose key-value store of properties attributed to this entity.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: featureSpecId
members.doc: Reference FeatureSpec

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of usages the users will be eligible for when purchasing this product. Other attributes (units/period) are derived from the FeatureSpec.
 When this field is not defined , the feature is unlimited.
 In the case of limited free and unlimited premium , the limit in feature spec default should be defined with value
 and here in product feature it should be undefined.

members.name: properties
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.  General-purpose key-value store of properties attributed to this entity.

members.name: excludedCycles
members.doc:
A blacklist of payment cycles for which the feature will _not_ be delivered.

Note that a product can be purchased at a given recurring payment cycle only if a pricing plan is defined for the tuple <ProductId x Cycle>.
Pricing plans are currently defined in SBS, and attached to this product by the billing_product_id field.

The effective list of payment cycles entitling a user for a feature will be: cycles that have a pricing for this product and are not blacklisted in "excluded_cycles" field below.

members.name: couponTemplateId
members.doc: Reference to a coupon template (managed by com.wixpress.billing.coupons-core-service)

members.name: eligibleCycles
members.doc: list of payment cycle this coupon eligible at

members.name: eligibleCycles
members.doc: list of payment cycle this coupon eligible at.

members.name: voucherType
members.doc: type of voucher to allocate (closed list in premium vouchers)

members.name: newPurchasesOnly
members.doc:
indicate for this coupon to be eligible for new purchase only or not
when true eligible only for new purchases and not for upgrade, if false eligible for both

members.name: eligibleCountries
members.doc:
list of countries where this voucher eligible for , default empty list
 will allow all countries

members.name: productId
members.doc: Map of Guid (String) of license product

members.name: amount
members.doc: amount (Int) of the licenses granted.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.  General-purpose key-value store of properties attributed to this entity.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: id
members.doc: Entity primary ID

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the product. Meant for internal use, but also serves as a fallback for display purposes when Product name is not provided by "Display Layer".

members.name: description
members.doc: More information about this product. For internal use.

members.name: features
members.doc: Features that will be delivered when purchasing this product.

members.name: productTypeId
members.doc:
A mandatory reference to ProductType entity.
As many products can refer to the same ProductType, this property divides all products to disjoint sets.
Products with the same ProductType ID share some properties, as described in ProductType section.

members.name: productFamilyId
members.doc:
A mandatory reference to ProductFamily entity.
Serves as secondary division of products into groups. Might be removed in future versions.

members.name: productSettingsOverrideId
members.doc:
An optional reference ProductSubscriptionSettings.
  When empty, inherits the subscription management settings of its ancestors (product family, product type).
  When specified, non-empty attributes will override the settings inherited from its parent (empty attributes will still be inherited).

members.name: productStatus
members.doc: Reflects the current status of the product. see "Product Lifecycle" section for more details.

members.name: billingProductId
members.doc:
Reference to the SBS product catalog, containing the "pricing plan", "localization maps" and additional product settings
  SBS product catalog is planned to be merged into this one in the future.

members.name: additionalProperties
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.  General-purpose key-value store of properties attributed to this entity.

members.name: internalCouponTemplates
members.doc: Wix internal coupons that will be generated when purchasing this product

members.name: externalVoucherTemplates
members.doc: Non wix vouchers that will be given with this product

members.name: bulkLicenses
members.doc: List of license products and amounts

members.name: createdAt
members.doc: Time when Product was created.

members.name: updatedAt
members.doc: Time when Product was last updated.

members.name: name
members.doc: Display name of product family. for internal use.

members.name: productTypeId
members.doc: Product Type containing this family (there can be many product families in the same type).

members.name: productSubscriptionSettingsOverrideId
members.doc: ref to settings.ProductSubscriptionSettings

members.doc: ID of target entity

members.doc: ID of newly created entity

members.name: id
members.doc: ID of target entity

members.name: family
members.doc: Requested entity

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.  General-purpose key-value store of properties attributed to this feature spec.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: id
members.doc: Entity primary ID

members.name: uniqueName
members.doc:
lower-case letters, numbers and dashes (-) only: [a-z0-9-]*
this name will be used by developers in the code to identify the feature they are looking for.

members.name: displayName
members.doc: Name of the feature. Meant for internal usage, but also serves as a fallback for display purposes when Feature name is not provided by "Display Layer".

members.name: description
members.doc: More information about this feature. For internal usage.

members.name: supportedProductTypes
members.doc:
List of Product types in which this feature may be included.
  A product of type that is not included here will not be allowed to add this feature.

members.name: context
members.doc: Scope in which the feature takes effect. See FeatureContext for more info.

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the feature. See FeatureStatus for more info.

members.name: requiredForUpgrade
members.doc:
Upgrade path restriction. Features with this flag set to "true" forbid upgrading a subscription from a product that DOES contain this feature to a product that DOESN'T.

Example:
given Feature Spec "Magic Powers" with requiredForUpgrade property set to true,
given Product A and Product B that includes feature "Magic Powers" and Product C that doesn't contain it.
assuming price(Product A) < price(Product B) < price(Product C)
then - a subscription of Product A can be upgraded to Product B but NOT to Product C, due to the requiredForUpgrade constraint.

members.name: additionalProperties
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.  General-purpose key-value store of properties attributed to this feature spec.

members.name: quantityInfo
members.doc: Quantity characteristics of the spec. Features without explicit information are assumed to be Boolean.

members.name: createdAt
members.doc: Time when Feature Spec was created.

members.name: updatedAt
members.doc: Time when Feature Spec was last updated.

members.name: booleanFeature
members.doc:
A feature that can be either "enabled" or "disabled". The default/freemium setting is always OFF, and the premium setting is always ON (meaning, unlimited usage without tracking).
  A boolean feature is similar to a quantitive feature with a default limit of 0 and UNLIMITED premium limit (although a bit simplified).

members.name: defaultQuota
members.doc: A feature with a periodic usage limitation. The default limit is defined in the Feature Spec, the Premium limits are defined in the respective ProductFeature.

members.name: limit
members.doc: The number of items to load

members.name: offset
members.doc: number of items to skip in the current sort order

members.name: featureSpecId
members.doc: ID of requested feature

members.name: featureSpec
members.doc: Feature Spec entity

members.name: paging
members.doc: Optional pagination

members.name: statusFilter
members.doc: Filter features that match this status.

members.name: id
members.doc:
Optional: specify the ID of the newly created Feature. Useful for idempotent calls.
  Keep empty to let server auto-generate an ID

members.doc: Readable name to be used as a reference in the code. alphanumeric and dashes.

members.name: displayName
members.doc: English name of the feature. Meant for internal usage, but also serves as a fallback for display properties when Feature name is not provided by "display layer".

members.name: description
members.doc: More information about this feature. For internal usage.

members.name: context
members.doc: Scope in which the feature takes effect. See FeatureContext for more info.

members.name: requiredForUpgrade
members.doc: Upgrade path restriction. Features with this flag set to "true" forbid upgrading a subscription from a product that DOES contain this feature to a product that DOESN'T.

members.name: quantity
members.doc: Quantity characteristics of the spec. Features without explicit information are assumed to be Boolean.

members.name: booleanFeature
members.doc: A feature that can be either "enabled" or "disabled". The default/freemium setting is always OFF, and the premium setting is always ON (meaning, unlimited usage without tracking).

members.name: defaultQuota
members.doc: A feature with a periodic usage limitation. The default limit is defined in the Feature Spec, the Premium limits are defined in the respective ProductFeature.

members.doc: Display name override (optional)

members.name: description
members.doc: Description override (optional)

members.name: context
members.doc: Scope in which the feature takes effect. See FeatureContext for more info.

members.name: requiredForUpgrade
members.doc: Required for upgrade override (optional)

members.name: quantity
members.doc: Quantity characteristics of the spec. Not specifying any will leave the feature unchanged.

members.name: booleanFeature
members.doc: A feature that can be either "enabled" or "disabled". The default/freemium setting is always OFF, and the premium setting is always ON (meaning, unlimited usage without tracking).

members.name: defaultQuota
members.doc: A feature with a periodic usage limitation. The default limit is defined in the Feature Spec, the Premium limits are defined in the respective ProductFeature.

members.name: featureIds
members.doc: IDs of requested features

members.name: id
members.doc: Entity primary ID

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the product type. Meant for internal use, but also serves as a fallback for display purposes when Product Type name is not provided by "Display Layer".

members.name: productSettingsId
members.doc: Reference to ProductSubscriptionSettings. Products belonging to this type will inherit these settings unless overridden.

members.name: primaryContext
members.doc:
Context which the subscription will be assigned to.
  ACCOUNT context means there can be only 1 subscription per account, and it can not be assigned to a site
  SITE context means there can be only 1 subscription per site, and it can be assigned to a site or floating (at account level)

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the product type. Meant for internal use, but also serves as a fallback for display purposes when Product Type name is not provided by "Display Layer".

members.name: productSubscriptionSettingsId
members.doc: Reference to ProductSubscriptionSettings. Products belonging to this type will inherit these settings unless overridden.

docs.summary: Deprecated use NotificationSettings instead

members.name: created
members.doc: Ping template to send to the user when a subscription is created.

members.name: cancelled
members.doc: Ping template to send to the user when a subscription is cancelled.

members.name: aboutToBeRenewed
members.doc:
Ping template to send to the user when a subscription is about to be renewed
  Only applicable for subscriptions with auto-recurring _enabled_.
  Number of days before actual renewal to trigger this notification is configured in SBS.

members.name: aboutToExpire
members.doc:
Ping template to send to the user when a subscription is about to be expired.
  Only applicable for subscriptions with auto-recurring _disabled_.
  Number of days before actual renewal to trigger this notification is configured in SBS.

members.name: chargeFailure
members.doc: Ping template to send to the user when a *recurring* charge has failed (there are several attempts before giving up and cancelling the subscription).

members.name: recurringSuccess
members.doc:
Ping template to send to the user when a *recurring* charge has succeeded.
  This event means that the subscription has been extended for an additional cycle.

members.name: manualRecurringReminder
members.doc:
Ping template to send to the user for manual recurring reminder.
  Only applicable for subscriptions that have manual payment methods

members.name: offlinePayment
members.doc:
Ping template to send to the user when waiting for offline payment.
  Only applicable for subscriptions that have manual payment methods

members.name: chargeback
members.doc: Ping template to send to the user when there has been a charge back

members.name: noActiveBillingAccount
members.doc: Ping template to send to the user when there is no active billing account for the subscription

members.name: cancelledPaymentProblems
members.doc: Ping template to send to the user when the subscription is cancelled due to payment problems

members.name: autoRenewTurnedOff
members.doc:
Ping template to send to the user when the auto-recurring is disabled
 TODO - add another value for the cycle upgrade mail on near renewal

members.name: templateSettings
members.doc: List of notification template settings

members.name: templateType
members.doc: notification type

members.name: templateName
members.doc: name of the *Ping* template to use for this notification

members.name: id
members.doc: Entity primary ID

members.name: description
members.doc: Entity description - for internal use.

members.name: emailSettings
members.doc: deprecated use NotificationSettings instead

members.name: cancellationPolicy
members.doc: NONE means inherit from parent settings

members.name: allowedActions
members.doc:
Control whether the following actions can be performed on the subscription.
  Action left empty will inherit from parent settings object. Default is false.

members.name: notificationSettings
members.doc:
Configure which events should trigger notifications as well as the requested template names (integrated with Ping).
  Leave empty to inherit from parent entity.

members.name: noMoneyBack
members.doc:
Subscription does not allow cancellations once purchase is made.
  User may choose not to renew the subscription on the next billing cycle.

members.name: officialMoneyBackPolicy
members.doc: User may cancel the subscription during the trial period defined below and get *full refund* for the purchase.

docs.summary: User may cancel the subscription during the trial period defined below and get *full refund* for the purchase.

members.name: trialDays
members.doc: Trial duration in days.

docs.summary:
Subscription does not allow cancellations once purchase is made.
  User may choose not to renew the subscription on the next billing cycle.

members.name: allowTransferToAnotherAccount
members.doc:
Allow user to transfer the subscription to another account (through "Transfer Site" flow).
  No value implies false

members.name: allowDisconnectFromContext
members.doc:
Allow user to disconnect the subscription from its context (e.g., site).
  Subscription that can be disconnected can also be connected to another context.
  No value implies false

members.name: disallowAutoRenewOff
members.doc:
Block the user from setting the renewal status of the subscription to "false" (only applicable to subscriptions when the assigned payment method is auto-recurring).
  No value implies false

members.name: id
members.doc:
Optional: specify the ID of the newly created Product. Useful for idempotent calls.
  Keep empty to let server auto-generate an ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the product. Meant for internal use, but also serves as a fallback for display purposes when Product name is not provided by "Display Layer".

members.name: description
members.doc: More information about this product. For internal use.

members.name: features
members.doc: Features that will be delivered when purchasing this product.

members.name: productTypeId
members.doc: ref to producttype.ProductType

members.name: productSettingsOverrideId
members.doc:
An optional reference ProductSubscriptionSettings.
  When empty, inherits the subscription management settings of its ancestors (product family, product type).
  When specified, non-empty attributes will override the settings inherited from its parent (empty attributes will still be inherited).

members.name: productFamilyId
members.doc:
A mandatory reference to ProductFamily entity.
Serves as secondary division of products into groups. Might be removed in future versions.

members.doc: reference to the SBS product catalog, containing the "pricing plan", "localization maps" and additional product settings

docs.summary:
Determines the reset cycle of the feature usage. Possible values are:
  • NO_PERIOD
  • MILLISECOND
  • SECOND
  • MINUTE
  • HOUR
  • WEEK
  • MONTH
  • YEAR
  • DAY

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN - unknown interval unit
  • DAY - day
  • WEEK - week
  • MONTH - month
  • YEAR - year

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • DRAFT - new product that can be updated but cannot be offered to users for purchase.
  • PUBLISHED - active product that can be offered to users. instance of this object may exist, so most changes are prohibited.
  • ARCHIVED - inactive product. it cannot be purchased, but existing instances of it may still exist.

Scope where the _feature instances_ take effect (only impacts the purchased subscriptions). Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • ACCOUNT - Account level feature instances take effect as long as the subscription containing them is active. Feature instances of such feature are agnostic to the context of their subscription - they will always be in ACCOUNT context and assigning/un-assigning subscriptions to a site does not affect them.
  • SITE - Site level feature instances only take effect when the subscription containing them is connected to a site. Instances of SITE context feature apply to the site for which the subscription containing them is connected. Moving a subscription between sites will update their context. When a subscription that contains SITE context features is not assigned to a site, the SITE features will be suspended.
  • EXTERNAL_MANAGEMENT - feature which may or may not have effect on site context, but it is not managed by subscriptions manager.

Every feature is created in DRAFT mode. Status can be manipulated with dedicated actions: Publish, Archive, Unarchive. Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • DRAFT - A feature that can be edited, but cannot be added to products.
  • PUBLISHED - A feature that can be added to new products, but editing some of its properties is no longer allowed (as instances of this feature may already exist).
  • ARCHIVED - A feature that can no longer be added to new products. This feature will still be available and active in the products that already contain it.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • ACCOUNT - Products of this type must be at account level and can only have one subscription per account
  • SITE - Products of this type can be assigned to a site and can only have one subscription per site if ProductSubscriptionSettings has allow_disconnect_from_context then it can also be floating (at account level)

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • CREATED - Notification when a subscription is created. See `InitialPurchaseParams` for list of available parameters
  • ABOUT_TO_BE_RENEWED - Notification when a subscription is about to be renewed Only applicable for subscriptions with auto-recurring _enabled_. Number of days before actual renewal to trigger this notification is configured in SBS. See `NearRenewalParams` for list of available parameters
  • ABOUT_TO_BE_RENEWED_UPGRADE_CYCLE - Notification when a subscription is about to be renewed and there is an offer to upgrade the cycle Only applicable for subscriptions with auto-recurring _enabled_. See `NearRenewalUpgradeCycleParams` for list of available parameters
  • ABOUT_TO_EXPIRE - Notification when a subscription is about to be expired. Only applicable for subscriptions with auto-recurring _disabled_. Number of days before actual renewal to trigger this notification is configured in SBS. See `NearExpirationParams` for list of available parameters
  • RECURRING_SUCCESS - Notification when a *recurring* charge has succeeded. This event means that the subscription has been extended for an additional cycle. See `RecurringChargeSuccessParams` for list of available parameters
  • AUTO_RENEW_TURNED_OFF - Notification when the auto-recurring is disabled See `AutoRenewOffParams` for list of available parameters
  • CANCELLED_BY_USER - Notification when a subscription is cancelled by the user. See `CancelImmediateByUserParams` for list of available parameters
  • CANCELLED_PAYMENT_PROBLEMS - Notification when the subscription is cancelled due to payment problems See `CancelDueToPaymentProblemsParams` for list of available parameters
  • NO_ACTIVE_BILLING_ACCOUNT - Notification when there is no active billing account for the subscription See `NoActiveBillingAccountParams` for list of available parameters
  • CHARGE_FAILURE - Notification when a *recurring* charge has failed (there are several attempts before giving up and cancelling the subscription). See `ChargeFailureParams` for list of available parameters
  • CHARGEBACK - Notification when there has been a charge back See `ChargebackParams` for list of available parameters
  • MANUAL_RECURRING_REMINDER - Notification for manual recurring reminder. Only applicable for subscriptions that have manual payment methods See `ManualRecurringReminderParams` for list of available parameters
  • OFFLINE_PAYMENT - Notification when waiting for offline payment. Only applicable for SEPA payment methods when invoice status is "PAYMENT_IN_PROGRESS" See `OfflinePaymentParams` for list of available parameters
